results.title: A Burn's best friend
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum and St John Ambulance Australia
results.brief_description: This film deals with burns caused by sun, chemicals, steam and fire, stressing that COLD WATER is the best first aid treatment where injury is susceptible to infection. It explains the medical principle behind this treatment.

results.title: A Burlesque on Carmen
results.creator_credit: Essanay Film Manufacturing Company, Jesse Robbins and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: This film was intended by Chaplin to be a two-reel film, but to his annoyance additional material was added after he left Essanay, the Production Company of the film. It is a parody of two contemporary films based on Bizet’s opera, by Cecil B. De Mille (starring Geraldine Ferrar) and Raoul Walsh (starring vamp Theda Bara). Chaplin plays Darn Hosiery (Don Jose), the Corporal of the Guard who is seduced by Carmen (Edna Purviance) so that gypsy smugglers can get their swag through the city gates. His chief rivals for Carmen’s affections are Escamillo, the toreador and a fellow soldier of the guard, Leo White.

results.title: A Building survives: Olderfleet
results.brief_description: Features an interview with the architects and/or builders who renovated the Olderfleet building in Collins Street, Melbourne without destroying its original facade. From the ABC television program “This Day Tonight” October 1973.

results.title: A Brother for Susan
results.creator_credit: Southalls Ltd, Oswald Skilbeck and Winifred Holmes
results.brief_description: An account of the processes of human gestation from fertilization to the birth of a child. The film answers many question which arise in the mind of a fourteen-year-old child. Shows the visits of the mother to a baby clinic; explains how the human egg is fertilized; how menstruation ceases; the creation of the embryo, its growth to a nine-month baby, and its ultimate delivery.

results.title: A British trade union
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An account of the work of a shop steward in a furniture factory is used to illustrate how a British trade union functions. The film gives a comprehensive outline of union organisation, explaining the relationship between employees and their union and between the union, at several levels, and the employers.

results.title: A Brilliant madness [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Yellow Jersey Films, American Experience, Randall MacLowry and Mark Samels
results.brief_description: This is an inspirational biographical documentary on the real John Nash, subject of the feature film “A Beautiful mind” which cast Russell Crowe in the role of John Nash. Born in 1928 in Bluefield, Virginia, John grew up to be an exceptionally brilliant mathematician attending Princeton University. There he was described as odd, non-conformist, elitist, brash, egocentric, genius, competitive, a man who would push the boundaries in the mathematical world with his theories. At Princeton he devised his Nobel Prize (awarded decades later in 1994) winning “Game Theory” which describes strategies in competition, particularly in the area of economics. In 1951 he joined the faculty of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Cambridge where he became renowned as one of the brightest mathematicians in the world. However in 1958 at the age of 30 his life took a dramatic turn when he suffered a psychotic episode and was hospitalised. He was eventually diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia. For the next three decades John Nash’s life was turned upside down. His personality was dogged by delusions of grandeur, conspiracies and paranoia requiring several bouts of hospitalisation until the 1980s when a second transformation occurred - a re-awakening. Off medication since the 1970s it appears that John Nash almost willed the voices away, rejecting the madness that had nearly destroyed his life. Through archival footage, stills, re-enactments and interviews with family, friends, colleagues and John Nash himself, this beautifully presented documentary gives an honest and factual account of this highly respected but somewhat eccentric mathematician’s journey into the darker side of life. Narrated by Liev Schreiber.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yellow Jersey Films, American Experience, Randall MacLowry and Mark Samels

results.title: A Brief history of astronomy
results.creator_credit: Manitoba Museum of Man and Nature and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An animated film tracing humankind’s appreciation of the universe, from the earliest interest in the sun and sky, throughout history to our present knowledge of modern astronomy. Reviews the ideas of great thinkers and philosophers like Ptolemy, Copernicus, Tycho Brahe, Kepler, Galileo and Newtown.

results.title: A Bridge of friendship
results.brief_description: The 6th Boy Scout Jamboree held at Lansdowne, Sydney, 1960-1961, from the initial planning to the closing ceremony. Scouts from all over the world came for fifteen days, rigging tents, cooking, exchanging badges, singing around the campfire. Shows the march through Sydney and the visits of the Governor-General and other notable people.

results.title: A Breath of air
results.brief_description: The film’s main purpose is to help to discourage cigarette smoking by teenagers. It presents to secondary school students a summary of biological and other scientific evidence on the health hazards of smoking. The film contains animated sequences, microphotography, still photos and charts which effectively present its case against smoking cigarettes.

results.title: A Boys' winter games lesson
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and Andrew Miller Jones
results.brief_description: This film shows a typical organised field games lesson for a class of boys aged 11 from an elementary school in a congested area of a big city. The lesson includes Association football and Rugby Touch, together with group practices leading up to these games. Based on British Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools, 1933.
